channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Isomorphism and Fuzzy Subspaces
item.description: arXiv:2508.02699v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This work provides a necessary and sufficient condition for the isomorphism of two fuzzy subspaces in terms of their dimensions.
item.dc:creator: Iffat Jahan

item.title: On a local property of fences and fans
item.description: arXiv:2508.03530v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Two closely related classes of topological spaces are fences and fans. A fence is a compact metric space whose components are either arcs or singletons. A fan is a continuum formed by joining arcs at a common vertex, in such a way that intersections of subcontinua are always connected. We prove that every fence can be embedded in the plane and that both fences and fans admit a basis consisting of pierced open sets. This resolves a question by Iztok Bani\v{c}, Goran Erceg, Ivan Jeli\'c, Judy Kennedy, and Van Nall.
item.dc:creator: David S. Lipham

item.title: Commutative Quantale and Localization
item.description: arXiv:2508.02991v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper we introduce the localization construction for quantales. A quantale is a complete semilattice combined with a multiplication. We mimic the notion of filter in a lattice to define multiplicative filters in a quantale, and construct the localization of the quantale at a multiplicative filter. We prove theorems with similar structure as "$\Spec R$ is a sheaf" and use them to obtain several results in algebra and geometry, including the Baire Category Theorem and some of its generalizations. We also present an algebraic version of Baire Category Theorem, which we believe has not appeared in literature.
item.dc:creator: Bangzheng Li, Yichen Xiao
